name: personality
explanation: The disposition and mindset of a character.
structure: Produces entries for different types of genres and worlds. The 'common' and 'rare' tables are generic and should be compatible with almost any world. To retain compatibility with most settings, the  non-generic tables should be called only from other tables by specifying their name directly.

tables.name: init
tables.explanation: Initializing the required global variables, if any.

tables.name: openness
tables.explanation: The degree of imagination and openness to experience.

tables.name: minimal openness
tables.explanation: The lowest degree of openness to experience.

tables.name: low openness
tables.explanation: Low degree of imagination and openness to experience.
entries: prefers to follow old traditions rather than adopt something new

tables.name: medium openness
tables.explanation: Medium degree of imagination and openness to experience.
entries: needs proof before accepting unfamiliar statements

tables.name: high openness
tables.explanation: High degree of imagination and openness to experience.

tables.name: maximal openness
tables.explanation: The highest degree of openness to experience.
entries: does not want to believe that anyone would mean harm

tables.name: minimal conscientiousness
entries: makes even the most important decision without proper consideration

tables.name: high conscientiousness
entries: likes to be prepared for anything

tables.name: maximal conscientiousness
entries: ponders even the smallest of details before making a decision

tables.name: extroversion
tables.explanation: The degree of outgoing and talkative behaviour.

tables.name: minimal extroversion
tables.explanation: The lowest degree of outgoing and talkative behaviour.
entries: is shut-in and does not want to open up to others

tables.name: low extroversion
tables.explanation: Low degree of outgoing and talkative behaviour.
entries: prefers to keep in the background

tables.name: medium extroversion
tables.explanation: Medium degree of outgoing and talkative behaviour.
entries: takes charge only when no one else is willing to do that

tables.name: high extroversion
tables.explanation: High degree of outgoing and talkative behaviour.
entries: likes to take control of things

tables.name: maximal extroversion
tables.explanation: The highest degree of outgoing and talkative behaviour.
entries: wants to be the center of attention
cannot do withouth the company of others

tables.name: agreeableness
tables.explanation: The degree of sympathetic and warm characteristics.

tables.name: minimal agreeableness
tables.explanation: The lowest degree of sympathetic characteristics.
entries: likes to criticize others and their plans
tends to be aggressive towards others
feels little concern for the wellbeing of others

tables.name: low agreeableness
tables.explanation: Low degree of sympathetic and warm characteristics.
entries: does not like to give their time to others
holds grudges for a long time

tables.name: medium agreeableness
tables.explanation: Medium degree of sympathetic and warm characteristics.
entries: wants to keep to themselves when under stress

tables.name: high agreeableness
tables.explanation: High degree of sympathetic and warm characteristics.
entries: likes to give their time for other people

tables.name: maximal agreeableness
tables.explanation: The highest degree of sympathetic characteristics.
entries: has an extremely optimistic outlook to life

tables.name: minimal neuroticism
tables.explanation: The lowest degree of emotional stability.

tables.name: low neuroticism
entries: is not bothered by small details

tables.name: medium neuroticism
entries: gets tense and easily angered under stress

tables.name: maximal neuroticism
tables.explanation: The highest degree of emotional stability.
entries: is often tense and on the edge

tables.name: medium intelligence
entries: has more common sense than brains

tables.name: myth
tables.explanation: Personalities once rumoured to have existed.

tables.name: fantasy
tables.explanation: Personalities for fantasy worlds (with no basis in myth).

tables.name: animal
tables.explanation: Personality types for pets and other animals.

tables.name: degree
tables.explanation: The degree of a personality trait.

tables.name: feature
tables.format: Optionally appended to the end of the result.

tables.name: test
tables.explanation: Test routine for checking the generator functionality.
entries: result: {result}, summary: {summary}, detail: {detail}, common: {common}, rare: {rare}. Myth: {myth}, fantasy: {fantasy}, modern: {modern}, futuristic: {futuristic}. Special: {special}, feature: {feature}.
